components.description:
A yellow face with a frowning mouth and eyes and eyebrows scrunched downward in anger.

Conveys varying degrees of anger, from grumpiness and irritation to disgust and outrage. May also represent someone acting tough or being mean.

Samsung’s design previously featured a reddish face with clenched teeth and wrinkled chin. Google’s design also previously featured a reddish face, while Facebook’s and Microsoft's earlier designs had clenched teeth.
components.title: Angry Face

description:
A yellow face with a frowning mouth and eyes and eyebrows scrunched downward in anger.

Conveys varying degrees of anger, from grumpiness and irritation to disgust and outrage. May also represent someone acting tough or being mean.

Samsung’s design previously featured a reddish face with clenched teeth and wrinkled chin. Google’s design also previously featured a reddish face, while Facebook’s and Microsoft's earlier designs had clenched teeth.
title: Angry Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: An angry looking face. Has inward-facing eyebrows, and a frowning mouth. Expresses anger, grumpiness or annoyance at a situation. Angry Face http://emojipedia.org/angry-face/
emoji_net_data.name: angry face

bn:00097107a: Irritated, in a temper, feeling or displaying anger.

bn:00097146a: Troubled persistently especially with petty annoyances
Troubled persistently especially with petty annoyances.

bn:00097981a: Visibly irritated or annoyed; grouchy, irritable, in a foul mood; given to complaining or finding fault in an annoyed way.

bn:00083024v: To hinder or prevent (the efforts, plans, or desires) of.
To prevent; to halt; to cause to fail; to foil; to frustrate.
Hinder or prevent (the efforts, plans, or desires) of

bn:00093362v: To look at or repel with a scowl or a frown.

bn:00082641v: Cause annoyance in; disturb, especially by minor irritations
To make someone rather angry or impatient; to cause annoyance.

bn:13686327v: To madden, to anger, to frustrate.

bn:00004359n: The act of troubling or annoying someone
An act or instance of annoying.
Act of annoying, vexing or irritating.
Annoyance is an unpleasant mental state that is characterized by such effects as irritation and distraction from one's conscious thinking.
The act of annoying, vexing, or irritating.

bn:00004086n: Anger is an emotional response related to one's psychological interpretation of having been threatened.
Anger is a common emotional response to real or imagined threats or harm to oneself or others, characterized by a desire, whether internalized or expressed, to engage in aggressive retaliation.

bn:00025856n: In psychology, frustration is a common emotional response to opposition.
The feeling that accompanies an experience of being thwarted in attaining your goals
An emotional response to circumstances where one is obstructed from arriving at a goal.
